intro: Bromus squarrosus var. confertus, commonly known as the rough brome, is a perennial grass native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant features tufted,丛生 growth with slender, blue-green blades and awned spikelets. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
